title: Shares of several communication companies are trading lower following an increase in coronavirus cases in some US states that have reopened, leading to concerns of a second wave of the virus.

Shares of several communication companies are trading lower amid market weakness as investors await today's Federal Reserve decision and update on the state of the economy. Markets have sold off over the past few sessions following a recent surge.

Shares of several communication services companies are trading lower as equities sell off following recent rally. Stocks have rallied over the past week amid optimism towards the US economy reopening and investors have potentially taken some profits following run up.

Shares of several communication companies are trading higher on continued upward momentum surrounding the economy reopening, which would increase consumer spending and economic activity. New York City moved into phase one of its reopening plan on Monday.
Shares of several communication companies are trading higher following strong US jobs data and continued optimism amid the reopening of the economy.
Shares of several communication companies are trading higher as equities continue to gain on optimism over an economic reopening as well as a smaller-than-expected drop in nonfarm payrolls.

Shares of several communications companies are trading higher amid economic optimism, stemming from some US states reopening businesses, an increase in mortgage demand figures and positive vaccine sentiment.
Shares of several communication companies are trading higher as equities gain amid coronavirus vaccine hopes as well as a pickup in economic activity as some US states reopen businesses.

Shares of several communication companies are trading higher as equities gain strength on news that some U.S. states will reopen their economies in phases, increasing economic activity and optimism around the coronavirus pandemic.

Shares of several communication companies are trading lower with the overall market on continued downward momentum after oil prices fell to historic lows, partially stemming from weak demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

Shares of several communications and media companies are trading higher as equities gain amid a report suggesting Gilead Sciences' Remdesivir drug showed some effectiveness in treating the coronavirus. This has raised hopes of a sooner return to spending, economic activity, and investment.
Shares of several communication companies are trading lower amid overall market weakness stemming from the coronavirus pandemic which has caused a decrease in economic activity.
Shares of several communication services companies are trading lower amid continued uncertainty around the coronavirus.

Shares of several communication companies are trading higher as markets gain following a Federal Reserve loan program. Additionally, speculation of some coronavirus hotspots peaking could raise hopes of a sooner return to consumer spending.
